pullRequest.body:
Mainly defines:

- `structure GroupExtension N E G`: group extensions as short exact sequences `1 â†’ N â†’ E â†’ G â†’ 1`
- `structure GroupExtension.Equiv S S'`: equivalences of two group extensions `S : GroupExtension N E G` and `S' : GroupExtension N E' G`
- `structure GroupExtension.Splitting S`: splittings of a group extension `S`
- `def SemidirectProduct.toGroupExtension (Ï† : G â†’* MulAut N)`: the group extension associated with the semidirect product, `1 â†’ N â†’ N â‹Š[Ï†] G â†’ G â†’ 1`

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

The motivation of this PR is to add definitions required to formalise relationships between classification of group extensions by a commutative group and group cohomology, especially:
- a bijection between conjugacy classes of splittings of `SemidirectProduct.toGroupExtension Ï†` and `H1` (which is done in [my repository](https://github.com/yu-yama/GroupExtension/blob/main/GroupExtension/Abelian.lean#L119)); and
- a bijection between equivalence classes of group extensions and `H2` (which is WIP and also noted as a TODO here).
<https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/de6c2cd20c87474b696039a707b4c6348087c40a/Mathlib/RepresentationTheory/GroupCohomology/LowDegree.lean#L47-L49>

For now, I am opening this PR with the `Defs` file only, to get your opinions on the definitions. The other files are available in [my repository](https://github.com/yu-yama/GroupExtension), and I am happy to open another PR if that would be more convenient.

I would appreciate your comments.

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [6ae6e91989](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15049/commits/6ae6e91989de5b9e8b90280ef558ba0f14becd7a)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.GroupTheory.GroupExtension.Defs`|570|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ AddGroupExtension`
`+ GroupExtension`
`+ IsConj`
`+ conjAct`
`+ inl_conjAct_comm`
`+ inr_splitting`
`+ instance : FunLike S.Splitting G E`
`+ instance : MonoidHomClass S.Splitting G E`
`+ normal_inl_range`
`+ rightHom_comp_inl`
`+ rightHom_inl`
`+ toGroupExtension`
`+ toGroupExtension_inl`
`+ toGroupExtension_rightHom`
`++ Equiv`
`++ Splitting`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

Thanks!

maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by kbuzzard.

@riccardobrasca Thank you for your review. In commit 6ae6e91989de5b9e8b90280ef558ba0f14becd7a, I have additivised everything, **except** for: - `GroupExtension.conjAct : E â†’* MulAut N` (and a related lemma), because `AddGroupExtension.conjAct : E â†’+ AddAut N` would require `AddAut N` to be an additive group; and - `SemidirectProduct.toGroupExtension` (and related lemmas and a definition), because it depends on `SemidirectProduct` which is only defined for multiplicative groups in Mathlib. Should we leave them not additivised? Here is one workaround I came up with for the former, but it has a different type from what `@[to_additive]` would ideally generate. It will be tedious to additivise lemmas manually and also write `Multiplicative` every time we use it.
Workaround: homomorphism from Multiplicative E ```lean import Mathlib.Algebra.Group.Equiv.TypeTags import Mathlib.GroupTheory.GroupExtension.Defs namespace AddSubgroup variable {G : Type*} [AddGroup G] instance (H : AddSubgroup G) [hH : H.Normal] : H.toSubgroup.Normal where conj_mem := hH.conj_mem end AddSubgroup namespace AddGroupExtension variable {N E G : Type*} [AddGroup N] [AddGroup E] [AddGroup G] (S : AddGroupExtension N E G) noncomputable def conjAct' : Multiplicative E â†’* AddAut N where toFun e := (AddMonoidHom.ofInjective S.inl_injective).trans <| ((AddEquiv.toMultiplicative (G := S.inl.range) (H := S.inl.range)).symm (MulAut.conjNormal (H := AddSubgroup.toSubgroup S.inl.range) e)).trans (AddMonoidHom.ofInjective S.inl_injective).symm map_one' := by ext _ simp only [map_one, AddEquiv.trans_apply, AddEquiv.toMultiplicative_symm_apply_apply, MulEquiv.toMonoidHom_eq_coe, AddMonoidHom.toMultiplicative_symm_apply_apply, MonoidHom.coe_coe, MulAut.one_apply, toAdd_ofAdd, AddEquiv.symm_apply_apply, AddAut.one_apply] map_mul' _ _ := by ext _ simp only [map_mul, AddEquiv.trans_apply, AddEquiv.toMultiplicative_symm_apply_apply, MulEquiv.toMonoidHom_eq_coe, AddMonoidHom.toMultiplicative_symm_apply_apply, MonoidHom.coe_coe, MulAut.mul_apply, AddAut.mul_apply, AddEquiv.apply_symm_apply, ofAdd_toAdd] end AddGroupExtension ```

LGTM, thanks!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10315768184/job/28556606287)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10315768184/job/28556606840)
Do we want to additivize everything?
Do we want to additivize everything?

```suggestion
- `SemidirectProduct.toGroupExtension Ï†`: the canonical group extension associated to the semidirect product coming from `Ï† : G â†’* MulAut N`: `1 â†’ N â†’ N â‹Š[Ï†] G â†’ G â†’ 1`
```
Thank you for pointing that out. I've updated the docstrings in commit 401809f21a9febce05050d952d27f1b6ecdaadd1.
Maybe you should also make an instance of `MonoidHomClass`?

Thank you for the suggestion.
I've added it in commit 618d4f3711b1b1acc22e4d0a8643ca35dce95ce6.
Here and in several other places the sentence should end with a full stop.
Thank you. The styling is corrected in commit 604d8e066654af32d52e485face5cb75811107c2.

```suggestion
  map_mul s := s.sectionHom.map_mul'
  map_one s := s.sectionHom.map_one'
```

```suggestion
noncomputable def conjAct : E â†’* MulAut N where
  toFun e := (MonoidHom.ofInjective S.inl_injective).trans <|
    (MulAut.conjNormal e).trans (MonoidHom.ofInjective S.inl_injective).symm
  map_one' := by
    ext _
    simp only [map_one, MulEquiv.trans_apply, MulAut.one_apply, MulEquiv.symm_apply_apply]
  map_mul' _ _ := by
    ext _
    simp only [map_mul, MulEquiv.trans_apply, MulAut.mul_apply, MulEquiv.apply_symm_apply]
```
These look like good `simp` lemmas; though I think the RHS should perhaps be `.id`?

Thank you for the suggestions. They are specified as `simp` lemmas in commit ff7d69a2f626657041c366147d6fefab4889b5b4.
I don't quite get what "the RHS should perhaps be `.id`" means. Could you elaborate a little bit?
These 1's are not identity functions, they're the trivial element of G so I think this is OK.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(GroupTheory/GroupExtension/Defs): define group extensions
